file_content.text: We're not done with the vault. I'll send for more men, but they'll be a long time coming.
General! Soa--the Infernal One--is dead.
I heard. We all heard. His voice was in our skulls.
I'd heard that the Rakata ruled Korriban and the Sith in ancient times, but I'd never believed. Imagine our people, slaves to something like that.
It may have ruled once. But even then, it was defeated, and the Empire is stronger today.
We've beaten it now.
So it is--in part, because of you.
If you could solve all your problems, I wouldn't still be in business.
That's why you hire me.
Your point is well taken. At least you chose the winning side.
No species is supreme forever. There's no shame in accepting it.
Learning humility is wise.
But it is a bitter truth, and I expect it won't appear in the public histories. Still, a victory.
Hardly my concern.
Of course--the battle is won, and a threat to our galaxy has been defeated.
Whatever else may awaken in the Eternity Vault, we will be prepared to confront it. For the Empire!
The Eternity Vault is open. We'll be waiting.
The Empire's greatest heroes, assembled before me. Ha! If I die with you, I'll count it as an honor.
I have seen the face of the Emperor and power beyond reason, General. Your prisoners don't frighten me.
I'm not impressed.
I've fought ancient conspiracies and lost technology. Rakata prisoners shouldn't be a problem.
I'm not impressed.
I've had the entire Republic try to kill me. You've got nothing I haven't seen before.
I'm not impressed.
I admire your certainty.
We've been translating the Rakata inscriptions. Most are indecipherable, but a few refer to a prisoner called "the Infernal One."
We've seen the title before, in the Dead Corals of Rugosa and the Ziost Abyss. We thought it a myth--the Rakata warlord who bled and enslaved a thousand planets.
His people sealed him away, but the bombings opened a door. He wants freedom.
And now he's trying to escape.
Exactly what I'm afraid of.
This "Infernal One" can't be the only one locked away here.
But there are other prisoners?
I agree--yet another concern.
The legends say it took an army to stop the Infernal One before--the Rakata and the other ancients locked him away with his weapons.
The prisoners will serve us or die. Their weapons will belong to the Empire.
I'll seize the power here.
The Rakata served me once. Whatever they've left behind will serve me again.
I want the vault's secrets.
Yes, my lord. Good luck.
The weapons in that vault could give us an advantage over the Republic... if we play this right.
This could change the war.
That will be up to you. I wish you luck.
You want me to lead the charge against a galaxy-eating monster, it won't come cheap.
This will be a pricey job.
You've seen what else we've found on Belsavis. Whatever you can carry from the vault is yours--just survive.
Victory will be mine.
Victory will be mine.
You do the Empire proud. The Eternity Vault is yours to enter.
There's a war going on, and you're worried about alien mythology.
This is foolish superstition.
The Reclamation Service exists to see these threats before they destroy us, and the technologies of antiquity are our prize.
Do what you can. It's all I can ask.
If we don't do anything, though... well, the war against the Republic may be nothing next to what'll come.
My lord, forgive the lack of protocol, but war has broken the chain of command and my purpose is grave.
My lord, forgive the lack of protocol, but I knew Darth Thanaton well and it seemed wise to alert his successor.
Agent--we've never met, but I was directed to you by a mutual colleague who said you might help us in our hour of need.
You've made quite a name for yourself, bounty hunter, and I'm sure you have no shortage of employers. Still, hear me out.
I am General Threnoldt, commanding officer of the Imperial Reclamation Service. I understand you're familiar with us.
What's an archaeologist doing calling up a bounty hunter?
I take it you want something.
Lieutenant Drellik serves at my command. He's told me much of your organization.
I have one of your men.
He's a fine officer, and it's our privilege to work with the Dark Council.
You run archaeological expeditions to uncover Sith and alien artifacts.
You're military researchers...
And deal with the threats they represent.
The Empire needs us, of that I am certain--and right now, I need you.
We uncovered a new section of Belsavis prison during a bombing run. It'd been sealed for twenty thousand years, no exit to the surface.
Its alien builders, the Rakata, called it the "Eternity Vault." It's where they kept the prisoners and technology they could never afford to release.
I've been to the prison before. I've seen who--and what--they put there.
Belsavis prison is dangerous.
Then you know what it can mean for the Empire.
I've known fear before, and I know it today--any sane man would.
Report, General.
Pathetic, terrified man.
General! The shuttle is ready--we can fly to the Eternity Vault as soon as your team's prepped.
I've seen your incompetence.
What kind of prisoners?
Sounds like bad news.
